meanings.sent1: The tea was so washy that it tasted like watered-down juice.
meanings.sent2: The washy excuse he gave for being late didn't convince anyone.
meanings.sent3: The washy attempt at lifting the heavy box ended in failure.
meanings.sent4: Her washy arguments couldn't stand up to scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The washy fabric tore easily under pressure.

meanings.sent1: The washy sky on a rainy day made everything look dull.
meanings.sent2: She painted her room in a washy shade of blue.
meanings.sent3: The washy paint job left streaks on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The washy watercolor painting captured the artist's delicate touch.
meanings.sent5: The washy sunset painted the sky in pastel hues.

meanings.definition: To cleanse or clean with water or other liquid.
meanings.sent1: She will washy the dishes after dinner.
meanings.sent2: He likes to washy his car every weekend.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to washy itself in the small puddle.
meanings.sent4: The rain will washy away the dirt on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: They will washy the windows to let in more light.
